info.description: Take screenshots of any website in real time
info.title: Browshot API

parameters.description: level of information returned
parameters.name: details

post.description: Get hundreds or thousands of screenshots from a text file. You can use this API call or the dashboard. Unlike the other API calls, you must issue a POST request with the Content-Type "multipart/form-data" in order to upload the text file. The text file must contain the list of URLs to request, 1 URL per line. Failed screenshots will be tried up to 3 times before giving up.

parameters.description: instance ID to use
parameters.name: instance_id

parameters.description: text file to use
parameters.name: file

parameters.description: screenshots size - "screen" (default) or "page"
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: name of the batch
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: thumbnail width.
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: thumbnail height
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: delay

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: flash_delay

parameters.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.
parameters.name: screen_width

parameters.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)
parameters.name: screen_height

parameters.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)
parameters.name: priority

parameters.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: referer

parameters.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: post_data

parameters.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: cookie

parameters.description: URL of javascript file to execute after the page load event
parameters.name: script

parameters.description: level of information available with screenshot/info
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: saves the HTML of the rendered page which can be retrieved by the API call screenshot/html. This feature costs *1 credit* per screenshot.
parameters.name: html

parameters.description: maximum number of seconds to wait before triggering the PageLoad event. Note that delay will still be used. (default: 0 = disabled)
parameters.name: max_wait

parameters.description: any custom HTTP headers. (Not supported with Internet Explorer)
parameters.name: headers

parameters.description: image as PNG or JPEG
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: hosting option - s3 or browshot
parameters.name: hosting

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_height

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_width

parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_scale

parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)
parameters.name: hosting_bucket

parameters.description: file name to use (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_file

parameters.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_headers

post.summary: Requests thousands of screenshtos at once

get.description: Get the status of a batch requested through the API or through the dashboard.

parameters.description: batch ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: browser ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: instance ID
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Screenshots requests to private and shared instances require a positive balance.

*IMPORTANT*: Remember that you can only do 100 free screenshots per month. To used a premium instance, use instance_id=65 for example.

parameters.description: URL of the page to get a screenshot for
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: instance ID to use
parameters.name: instance_id

parameters.description: screenshot size - "screen" (default) or "page"
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: use a previous screenshot (same URL, same instance) if it was done within <cache_value> seconds. The default value is 24hours. Specify cache=0 if you want a new screenshot.
parameters.name: cache

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: delay

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: flash_delay

parameters.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.
parameters.name: screen_width

parameters.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)
parameters.name: screen_height

parameters.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)
parameters.name: priority

parameters.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: referer

parameters.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: post_data

parameters.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: cookie

parameters.description: URL of javascript file to execute after the page load event
parameters.name: script

parameters.description: level of information available with screenshot/info
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: saves the HTML of the rendered page which can be retrieved by the API call screenshot/html. This feature costs *1 credit* per screenshot.
parameters.name: html

parameters.description: maximum number of seconds to wait before triggering the PageLoad event. Note that delay will still be used. (default: 0 = disabled)
parameters.name: max_wait

parameters.description: any custom HTTP headers. (Not supported with Internet Explorer)
parameters.name: headers

parameters.description: take multiple screenshots of the same page. This costs 1 additional credit for every 2 additional screenshots.
parameters.name: shots

parameters.description: number of seconds between 2 screenshots
parameters.name: shot_interval

parameters.description: hosting option - s3 or browshot
parameters.name: hosting

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_height

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_width

parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_scale

parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)
parameters.name: hosting_bucket

parameters.description: file name to use (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_file

parameters.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_headers

get.description: You can delete details of your screenshots to remove any confidential information.

parameters.description: screenshot ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: data to remove. You can specify multiple of them (separated by a ,): *image* (image files), *url* (url requested), *metadata* (time added, time finished, post data, cookie and referer used for the screenshot), *all* (all data and files)
parameters.name: data

get.description: You can host screenshots and thumbnails on your own S3 account or on Browshot.

parameters.description: screenshot ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: hosting option: s3 or browshot
parameters.name: hosting

parameters.description: width of the thumbnail
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: height of the thumbnail
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail
parameters.name: scale

parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail - required with hosting=s3
parameters.name: bucket

parameters.description: file name to use - optional, used with hosting=s3
parameters.name: file

parameters.description: HTTP headers to add to your S3 object - optional, used with hosting=s3
parameters.name: headers

get.summary: Host thumbnails on your own S3 account or on Browshot.

get.description: Retrieve the HTML code of the rendered page. This API call should be used when html=1 was specified in the screenshot request.

parameters.description: screenshot ID
parameters.name: id

get.description: Once a screenshot has been requested, its status must be checked until it is either "error" or "finished".

parameters.description: screenshot ID received from /api/v1/screenshot/create
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: level of details about the screenshot and the page
parameters.name: details

get.description: Get information about the last 100 screenshots requested.

parameters.description: maximum number of screenshots' information to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: get list of screenshot in a given status (error, finished, in_process)
parameters.name: status

get.description:
Request multiple screenshots in one API call. The API call accepts all the parameters supported by screenshot/create.
You can specify up to 10 URLs and 10 instances for a total of 100 screenshots in one API call.

parameters.description: URL of the page to get a screenshot for. You can specify multiple url parameters (up to 10).
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: instance ID to use. You can specify multiple instance_id parameters (up to 10).
parameters.name: instance_id

parameters.description: screenshot size - "screen" (default) or "page"
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: use a previous screenshot (same URL, same instance) if it was done within <cache_value> seconds. The default value is 24hours. Specify cache=0 if you want a new screenshot.
parameters.name: cache

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: delay

parameters.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.
parameters.name: flash_delay

parameters.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.
parameters.name: screen_width

parameters.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)
parameters.name: screen_height

parameters.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)
parameters.name: priority

parameters.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: referer

parameters.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: post_data

parameters.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only
parameters.name: cookie

parameters.description: URL of javascript file to execute after the page load event
parameters.name: script

parameters.description: level of information available with screenshot/info
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: saves the HTML of the rendered page which can be retrieved by the API call screenshot/html. This feature costs *1 credit* per screenshot.
parameters.name: html

parameters.description: maximum number of seconds to wait before triggering the PageLoad event. Note that delay will still be used. (default: 0 = disabled)
parameters.name: max_wait

parameters.description: any custom HTTP headers. (Not supported with Internet Explorer)
parameters.name: headers

parameters.description: hosting option - s3 or browshot
parameters.name: hosting

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_height

parameters.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_width

parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail to host
parameters.name: hosting_scale

parameters.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)
parameters.name: hosting_bucket

parameters.description: file name to use (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_file

parameters.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)
parameters.name: hosting_headers

get.description: Search for screenshots of a specific URL.

parameters.description: look for a string matching the URL requested
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: maximum number of screenshots' information to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: get list of screenshot in a given status (error, finished, in_process)
parameters.name: status

get.description: You can make your screenshots public, add notes, and share it with your friends and colleagues. Only screenshots which are successfully completed can be shared.n the thumbnail. You can take a 1024x768 screenshot, crop it to 768x768, and get it scaled down to 300x300.

parameters.description: screenshot ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: note to add on the sharing page
parameters.name: note

get.description:
Unlike the other API calls, this API sends back the thumbnail as a PNG file, not JSON. The HTTP response code indicates whether the screenshot was successful (200), or incomplete (404) or failed (404). If the screenshot failed or is not finished, a default image "Not found" is sent.

You can crop your screenshots. The crop is done first, then the thumbnail. You can take a 1024x768 screenshot, crop it to 768x768, and get it scaled down to 300x300.

parameters.description: screenshot ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: width of the thumbnail
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: height of the thumbnail
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: scale of the thumbnail
parameters.name: scale

parameters.description: zoom 1 to 100 percent
parameters.name: zoom

parameters.description: Use fit to keep the original page ration, and fill to get a thumbnail for the exact width and height.  specified. If you provide both width and height, you need to specify the ratio: fit to keep the original width/height ratio (the thumbnail might be smaller than the specified width and height), or fill to crop the image if necessary.
parameters.name: ratio

parameters.description: left edge of the area to be cropped
parameters.name: left

parameters.description: right edge of the area to be cropped
parameters.name: right

parameters.description: top edge of the area to be cropped
parameters.name: top

parameters.description: bottom edge of the area to be cropped
parameters.name: bottom

parameters.description: image as PNG or JPEG
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: get the second or third screenshot if multiple screenshots were requested
parameters.name: shot

parameters.description: JPEG quality factor (for JPEG thumbnails only)
parameters.name: quality

balance.description: number of credits left on your account

browsers.description: list of custom browsers as returned by /api/v1/browser/list

free_screenshots_left.description: number of free screenshots available for the current month

hosting_browshot.description: 1 is your account is authorized to request hosting on Browshot, 0 otherwise (default)

instances.description: list of private instances as returned by /api/v1/instance/list

private_instances.description: 1 is your account is authorized to create and use private instances, 0 otherwise (default)

screenshots.description: list of 10 latest screenshots requests as returned by /api/v1/screenshot/list

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

count.description: number of unique URLs in the batch

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

flash.description: Flash support: 1 if enabled, 0 if disabled

javascript.description: JavaScript support: 1 if enabled, 0 if disabled

mobile.description: Mobile browser: 1 if true, 0 if false

name.description: browser name and version: Firefox 45, etc.

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

load.description:
instance load: 
< 1: new screenshot requests will be processed immediately, 
1-2: new screenshot requests will be processed in about two minutes, 
2-3: new screenshot requests will be processed in about four minutes, 
3-4: new screenshot requests will be processed in about six minutes, 
etc.

screenshot_cost.description: number of credits for each screenshot

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

cookie.description: custom cookie used (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie)

cost.description: number of credits spent for the screenshot

delay.description: number of seconds to wait after page load

details.description: level of details about the screenshot and the page

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

final_url.description: URL of the screenshot (redirections can occur)

flash_delay.description: number of seconds to wait after page load if Flash elements are present

instance_id.description: instance ID used for the screenshot

post_data.description: POST data sent (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie)

priority.description: priority given to the screenshot: high (1) to low (3)

referer.description: custom referrer used (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie)

scale.description: image scale. Always 1 for desktop browsers; mobiles may change the scale (zoom in or zoom out) to fit the page on the screen

script.description: URL of optional javascript file executed after the page load event

shared_url.description: if the screenshot was shared, show the public URL

error.description: description of the problem that occurred

priority.description: priority given to the screenshot - high (1) to low (3)

url.description: URL to the hosted screenshot or thumbnail

error.description: description of the problem that occurred
